column4: Hey guys, I've volume adjusters on my Keyboard and it shows the volume going up but isn't changing anything at all, any suggestions on where to look?
the speaker icon in your desktop may change
or, hover the speaker icon, read the volume, use the vol keys and hover the icon again
That is the wierd thing, the onscreen volume level shows up and changes it, it USED TO work before getting my mic to work but now this doesn't adjust anything
It feels like it's adjusting something I am not using like a surround sound speaker or something like that
double-click the icon so you can see all your controls
did that, and when i press it up or down it shows change, but none of them move, for playback or recording
maybe you changed the "controlled device"
there are about 5 screens with different tabs
which device is selected when you right-click the volume icon and select "preferences"?
mine is "ALSA mixer, Master mono"
Master, under the HDA intel (ALSA Mixer)
when using the volume control with my mouse I adjust master under HDA intel and I can hear a clear difference in volume
but you can't hear any difference when you use the keys?
and the icon matches the actual volume, the keys don't adjust the icon at all
it does the whole onscreen speaker and volume level when I use the keys
maybe the keys are affecting another control, or no one
that is what I am thinking, I just don't have any idea how to change it
oh, like the built-in amplifier
I did system >preferences > keyboard short cuts, and it's setup correctly
I just added a few more items to playback, and it looks like it's affecting microphone playback
